there‚Äôs no prompt today.content: not disappointed but who appointed me anyway to speak for a mass of people i don‚Äôt really know and the mass of hopes left to grow stale in the moonlight last night last sight he was running away with a link in his hand a link that could make a stand as crowds cheer in a dirty alley where hookers and hawkers peddle their wares staring into dead darkness with nothing going on but the throng of songs embedded in our heads staying there reminding us of what we‚Äôve seen until we‚Äôre dead with nothing left to say but i wish it would last just one more day

we buy we try we fly to new places which look just like where we came from and offer no new answers click fast don‚Äôt stay don‚Äôt read don‚Äôt play just keep moving on to the next pointless wealth of information that we don‚Äôt really care about anyway we‚Äôre so cool for fools we‚Äôre so empty that we‚Äôre always longing to be full
all connected by bridges leading to nowhere
a lottery window in the middle of poverty seems right somehow i forgot what it was like to be cold and hungry luck like ours is hard to come by days turning into night unfulfilled

creativity is shared.content: the un-followed and the birth of creativity

‚Äú**Share what you enjoy or what you're curious about.** Not everyone will enjoy of it, some people will appreciate different things, but build friendships on mutual interests. **Don't be afraid to say you don't know something. Being forthright and asking for help is an admirable quality.**‚Äù
Click on a paragraph* to view related ideas.

I‚Äôm convinced the thought that fills my mind most of the time is just a complex of [reactions](reactions.md) to the strange world I‚Äôm living in. Creative [urges](urges-1.md) struggle to redirect my mind to what I don‚Äôt see, to what might be.

Links are magical, affording the ability to share things that interest us with others and to bookmark those things we'd like to easily revisit in the future. If anything amazes me about the web, it is the magic of links.
I've been spending time gathering ideas in the [garden](https://ideas.joejenett.com) ‚Äì check it out and yeah, thanks for stopping by.
I spent some time today improvising lyrics to a slow 4-chord progression. What fun!

‚ÄúWhy do you go away? So that you can come back. So that you can see the place you came from with new eyes and extra colors. And the people there see you differently, too. Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving.‚Äù - Terry Pratchett
